#Text=Arrest made as mayor of Gdańsk , Poland stabbed on stage
#Text=Monday , January 14 , 2019
#Text=An individual has been arrested after Paweł Adamowicz , mayor of the Polish city of Gdańsk , was stabbed last night whilst on stage at a fundraising event .
#Text=He died today .
#Text=We could n’t win
#Text=— Łukasz Szumowski on the failed efforts to save the mayor 's life
#Text=Reports on the implement used vary between a knife and a " sharp tool " .

#Text=The attacker is reported to have jumped on stage during the Great Orchestra of Christmas Charity and claimed he was wrongfully imprisoned under Adamowicz 's former party Civic Platform ' s time in government .
#Text=Adamowicz was an early supporter of democracy , and has been mayor since 1998 .
#Text=Ex-Prime Minister Donald Tusk , the current President of the European Council , wrote " Let 's all pray for Mayor Adamowicz .

#Text=Health Minister Łukasz Szumowski said  We could n’t win , " and the city flag is at half-mast .

column1: #Text=Gdańsk residents donated blood by the hundreds today in a bid to assist .
#Text=Vigils nationwide this evening were attended by thousands .
#Text=Adamowicz , 53 , has supported LGBT rights and and the inclusion of minority groups .
#Text=He recently condemned anti-semitism after vandalism against a synagogue in the city .
#Text=Adamowicz was at the event after collecting money for the organisation in Gdańsk 's streets alongside volunteers nationwide .
#Text=A potential charge of murder against Stefan W carries a possible life sentence .
#Text=Prosecutor Krzysztof Sierak told reporters today psychiatric assessments will be carried out to confirm if Stefan W is fit for trial .
